Award.AbstractNarration:
This work concerns some problems in the theory of automorphic forms.
The PI proposes a study of the period integrals of automorphic forms through two approaches. One is through developing the relative trace formula, the other is using a period transference principle based on the Rankin-Selberg method and the explicit realization of Langlands functoriality.

This research is in the area of number theory. Number theory has its historical roots in the study of natural numbers. It is among the oldest branches of mathematics. Within the last half century it has become an indispensable tool in diverse applications in areas such as data transmission and processing, and communication systems

POR.DRECONTENT:
The PI's main focus of research is in automorphic forms. The notion of automorphic forms appears in many areas of mathematics, including algebra, number theory, geometry, and practical subjects such as cryptography and network design. During the past years the PI collaborated with E. Lapid in the study of Whittaker-Fourier coefficients of automorphic forms.

 We made a precise conjecture on the relations between these coefficients and the special value of L-functions, which is analogous to the Ichino-Ikeda conjecture on the Gross-Prasad period of automorphic forms. We substantiated our conjecture by proving it in many low rank cases. We introduced the use of Ginzburg-Rallis-Soudry descent method in these problems and were able to establish our conjecture in the case of metaplectic groups up to some technical assumptions.  

Our research interacts with several other areas of automorphic forms and representation theory. In harmonic analysis we proved stability of oscillatory integrals of Whittaker functions and matrix coefficients, in particular we were able to generalize the notion of Bessel function to any generic representation of split groups. In theory of distinguished representations, we proved some new function equations for distinguished representations, and established explicit transformations between various models of these representations.

The PI also continued the prior works on Fourier coefficients of half integral weight forms, and proved a generalization of a formula of Gross in this setting. With M. Baruch and E. Lapid we established a relation between Bessel distributions under the theta correspondence.

The PI directed the research of C. Valverde who received his Ph.D degree in May 2012.
